intro: Streptopus koreanus, commonly known as the Korean starwort, is a perennial herb native to Korea and parts of eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically pinnately divided, with a feathery appearance. Streptopus koreanus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
